intro: Lycopodium brassii, commonly known as the Mexican clubmoss, is a species of lycophyte that belongs to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and a distinctive, branched sporophyte structure. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or rocky crevices. Its spores are produced in cone-like structures called strobila, which are borne on the upper parts of the plant. Lycopodium brassii plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
